oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Letter from a solider named Mack to his sister
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: In this letter, written on letter head for the 114th Field Art., 30th Div., an unidentified soldier named "Mack" writes to his sister about the snow, digging gun pits and the fact that he got to see his father briefly as he passed by Camp Sevier. Handwirtten under the crossed barrels of the letterhead is the letter "B" indicating Btry. B, 114th Field Art. The 114th was part of the 30th Div. and was composed largely of men from the Chattanooga area.
